ygData.subject: Spoilers
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It is good that those supplying information some will consider spoilers should give such warning.  That said, I ll offer my take on this forum and
ygData.messageBody:
At 12:52 PM 6/18/99 -0400, John Robertson wrote:
>Spoilers below... though not many.

It is good that those supplying information some will consider spoilers
should give such warning. That said, I'll offer my take on this forum and
spoilers.

I play EverQuest way too much. Since I got it I no longer vegetate in
front of the TV. I play. Hmmmm. Maybe overall that is an improvement. :-)}

Anyway, even playing that much there's a lot I miss due to time or don't
figure out or am a bit too careful about. In my mind and on an in-game
basis, this forum represents a conclave of bards, helping one another. I'm
a dedicated roleplayer, trying to keep the fantasy intact as much as I can
and avoiding fantasy-busters such as /loc or talking too much in terms of
software mechanisms, but I'm sure in an alternate reality like our game
world bards would share tales and information, suggesting good places to
see, profitable ventures, and particularly effective techniques and equipment.

Some want to discover it all for themselves. Some want the most power the
fastest. Some want to live a fantasy life. I want to have fun and avoid
major frustration and I find this forum a wonderful resouce to those ends.

Bob

Keep the information flowing. It is the life blood that runs through the
veins of the bards, the heart and soul of Norrath.

Thrush, human bard of the 14th circle, Freeport, Veeshan aspect
